Title: Cashier - Nelson, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
The Kootenay Co-op is looking for a Cashier to join our Front End team for 28-32 hours/ week. Our Cashiers are friendly, knowledgeable, efficient, and have amazing memories for produce codes! If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.
SKILLS WE’RE LOOKING FOR:
Technical expertise and accuracy in all cash procedures + in the use of Interac machines
Basic computer skills
Impeccable attendance + punctuality
Excellent customer service skills
Cooperative + respectful communication skills
Ability to approach problems with a positive attitude
Ability to handle stressful situations in a calm manner
General product knowledge, such as location of items or categories within the store
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Create a pleasant environment + maintain friendly interactions with customers
Develop + maintain speed + accuracy in all point of sale procedures
Conduct efficient + accurate cash float count and closing procedures
Keep apprised of personal accuracy trends
Keep cash counters + front area neat and clean
Assisting in other departments as time allows
Product knowledge – ingredients, uses, location in store, product information
Providing groceries packing service as required
Comply with all co-op policies and procedures
TO APPLY
Submit your application using our online form: https://www.kootenay.coop/join-our-team/
WHY WORK AT THE KOOTNEAY CO-OP?
Employees of the Co-op are truly unique. Our friendly, talented staff have created a culture of inclusiveness and teamwork, along with a passion for bringing organic, sustainable food to the Nelson area. Employees receive a store discount, health and dental benefits, RRSP contributions, and competitive wages. We value work-life balance, continuous improvement, and maintaining a friendly work environment where each staff member can get involved in making the Co-op a great place to shop and work.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From $16.00 per hour
Additional pay:
Bonus pay
Benefits:
Casual dress
Discounted or free food
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Paid time off
RRSP match
Store discount
Schedule:
8 hour shift
COVID-19 considerations:
Following Provincial Health Order regarding Covid-19 safety recommendations. Masks are mandatory for staff.
Ability to commute/relocate:
Nelson, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)
Language:
English (required)

Title: Cashier/Count - Hamilton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Do you have a passion for people and a knack for numbers? This may be the role you have been waiting for. The Cage Cashier demonstrates exceptional customer service, while accurately managing the care, control, transfer, and balancing of financial assets at the gaming site. You will be on the front lines handling cash and voucher transactions with patrons directly, as well as in the main bank helping your internal customers. You will work under Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO) regulations and comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures.
The successful candidate will possess:
A Secondary School Diploma
One or more years of experience in customer service and handling cash (preferably large volumes)
A strong knowledge of cash, foreign currency and other settlement types
A working knowledge of computer software and the ability to learn new software and systems
Excellent communication, multi-tasking, organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
A strong mathematical aptitude, ability to work in a physically demanding area and be familiar with a high-volume, fast paced, shift work environment.
The ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
Great Canadian Gaming Corporation encourages all applicants to be fully vaccinated with the COVID-19 Vaccine. Proof of vaccination is required for entry into our Company Premises unless an exemption is
required by law. Proof of full vaccination or undertaking rapid testing twice a week is a condition of employment for successful candidates. Great Canadian Gaming Corporation may update its COVID-19 Vaccination Policy and requirements at any time in its sole discretion.
Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

Title: Retail Cashier & Sales Floor Support - One Bloor Rack - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description
Earn up to a $500 sign-on bonus PLUS the opportunity for overnight hourly premium pay.
The ideal Nordstrom Rack team member enjoys working in a fast-pace, high-energy environment.
A day in the life…
Keep the customer experience quick, easy and fun while helping customers uncover the great deals theyre looking for
Create a smooth fitting room experience by greeting customers and taking them to their fitting rooms, then sorting and returning clothing to the floor
Share your love of fashion and tell customers all about upcoming events, our Nordstrom gift cards, Nordstrom RewardsTM program and mailing list
Keep the stockrooms organized and complete all inventory processes, making sure merchandise is properly checked in and accurately ticketed
Work with the team to ensure the sale’s floor stays runway ready through re-merchandising and straightening throughout the day
You own this if you have…
Enthusiasm and a sense of adventure, see the glass as half full
Accountability, initiative and a high level of ownership
Organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to prioritize multiple tasks
A calm head in a busy retail environment
Solid math, verbal and written communications skills
The ability to work a flexible schedule based on business needs
We’ve got you covered…
Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources
A few more important points...
The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.
Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.
Nordstrom Careers Privacy Policy: https://careers.nordstrom.com/#/contact-us/privacy
© 2021 Nordstrom, Inc.
Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

Title: Cashier Ottawa, Lansdowne - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Sporting Life
Sporting Life is a leading, iconic Canadian sports lifestyle retailer. Since 1979, we've been committed to providing our customers and their families with the best possible experience—and we are continuously working to improve it every day. We offer the best in outdoor apparel and fashion, footwear, equipment and accessories for men, women and kids. The mix of sport and fashion is what makes us unique.
YOU live for the great Canadian outdoors and take pride in
living the Sporting Life
. You relish in the exhilarating experience of skiing, snowboarding, cycling, running, tennis, hiking and camping and want to inspire our customers to do the same. You believe in the spirit of team, adapting to the ever-changing retail environment, being part of constant innovation and working alongside the best leaders, associates and vendors in the business. We are looking for those who live what we sell every day and who celebrate the love of sport and an active way of living.
Job Type: Cashier
As a Cashier, you are the first and last point of contact to our customers. You will be responsible to provide extraordinary customer service to our customers by providing an exceptional interaction during the completion of the sale transactions.
Your Responsibilities
Greets and directs customers.
Connects customers to sales associates to provide assistance
Provide excellent customer service through all steps of the sales transaction.
Accurately completes required paperwork for all transactions
Actively participate in our team tasks to deliver a full experience to our customers including store cleanliness, merchandising and restocking of product and control of inventory
What You Offer
A love of fashion, sport and a healthy, active lifestyle
An outgoing personality and an enthusiasm for sales and creating an amazing customer experience
A genuine passion for serving the public and ensuring that all customers are cared for
Desire to continually learn and develop knowledge around products
Who You Are
You live for the great Canadian Outdoors.
You live for Skiing, Snowboarding, Cycling, Running and Tennis.
The mix of fashion and sport is what makes us unique.
You believe in the spirit of team, joining leaders, being part of constant innovation and working alongside the best staff and vendors in the business.
What We Provide
Access to the best brands and vendors including training and learning opportunities
Competitive compensation
Amazing product discounts
Professional growth and development
Flexible schedules
Sporting Life is #unlikeanystoreintheworld
Sporting Life Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, please advise the Sporting Life Human Resources team of any accommodations required to ensure fair and equitable access through the recruitment and selection process.

Title: Winter 2021/2022 - Food & Bev: Support, Cashier & Events Staff - Kelowna, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Position:
Support, Cashier and Events
Location: Happy Valley Day Lodge
Reports to: Food & Beverage Managers / Supervisors
Employment: Seasonal, Full Time Start Date: Mid-November
Pay Rate: Start @ $15.20/hr End Date: Mid-April
Job Description: Responsible for the day to day maintenance and cleanliness of The Happy Valley Day Lodge. Our Support staff will also service banquet functions, weddings and other group bookings. Cashier in the cafeteria. Provide assistance to other staff across the Food and Beverage Department to help ensure a positive experience for our guests and staff. When serving alcohol, you are required to follow BC liquor laws and participate in our daily ID Pledge, stating that you will ask for 2 pieces of identification from anyone who looks under the age of 40.
Position Requirements/Skills:
Must have a valid Serving it Right Certificate or equivalent by the first day of employment. Dated on or after October 18th, 2018.
Understanding of Duty of Care as it relates to the responsible service of Alcohol.
Required to work flexible hours including nights, weekends and holidays and may be required to work overtime.
To work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Report for work on time.
Maintain a high standard of personal appearance and grooming, which includes wearing the correct uniform/foot wear and name tag while working.
Be familiar with the floor plans of the Lounge/ Cafeteria and Sk8ters.
Notifies the Managers/Supervisors of any maintenance issues that need to be repaired.
Keeps service areas and Guest areas stocked and clean.
Assist with group functions; set up, service, tear down.
Knowledge of SWP & SJP & WHMIS.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Sign ID Pledge daily, stating that you pledge to ID anyone who looks under 40. No exceptions.
Follow opening, closing and daily on-going procedures and checklist.
Clear and wipes all cafeteria/ Sk8ters tables and chairs, floors at all times to maintain high level of cleanliness and customer service.
Ensure cutlery/condiment stands/ Drink fridges are well stocked at all times
Checks all washroom facilities at regular intervals to maintain clean and fresh facilities.
Maintain excellent communication all positions as necessary to promote positive teamwork.
Performs all side work duties as assigned or requested by Managers and or Chef.
Clean windows/ entrance doors as needed
Salt/shovel entrances for guest/staff safety
Empty bins when full and ensure there are bags in the bottom
Maintain the cleanliness of the Garbage/Recycle room
Maintain the cleanliness of the Adventure Park Facilities
Assists team members as needed to promote positive guest experience
Physical Demands:
Spend significant portion of time spent standing and walking
Lift up to 50lbs multiple times a day
Work outside in cold conditions
Location: Big White Ski Resort
